name: ConfIDent-schema
description: This is a schema for the ConfIDent project that describes the necessary metadata requirements of academic events and event series.
title: ConfIDent metadata schema - v0.0.1

types.name: float
types.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification

types.name: double
types.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification

types.name: decimal
types.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification

types.name: time
types.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time

types.name: date
types.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time

types.name: datetime
types.description: The combination of a date and time

types.name: objectidentifier
types.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
comments: Used for inheritence and type checking

types.name: nodeidentifier
types.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.

enums.name: EventType
enums.description: The most common minimal event types. For event types that are not in this list, you can use "other" and provide the label of this other event format using the [event_format](event_format) property.

permissible_values.description: A colloquium is an academic meeting that usually lasts only a few hours and serves to discuss a specific topic. Colloquia are usually part of the academic exchange in everyday university life with only one speaker, but can also take place on special occasions (anniversaries, start or end of the lecture phase, etc.) and can have more than one speaker.

A conference is an academic event that lasts up to several days and serves as a forum for presentations on a specific topic or subject area. In addition to subject-specific conferences, there are also interdisciplinary conferences which allow both a broader focus and more specific questions on a particular (academic) problem. Conferences often have a highly formalized structure of parallel, clearly defined sessions with several short presentations and plenary sessions with invited (keynote) speakers who are considered multipliers in their (research) field. Ideally, the selection of the speakers and their contributions is subject to a review process.

A congress is a certain type of conference which is characterised by a larger number of participants (often several hundred) and is oftentimes organised jointly by large, established (e.g. specialised societies) and/or several institutions. Congresses have a broader thematic focus than simple conferences, take place in certain cycles, but can still target an exclusive group of participants (e.g. representatives of a single discipline).

A session is a clearly defined part of a academic event in which a small number of speakers (usually 2-5) focus on a specific topic. A session is usually formally accompanied by a session chair, who assumes the function of a moderator.
A poster session is a session at which poster papers are presented.
A talk is a central part of a larger academic event, at which a specific topic is being presented in a rather short way.
A keynote speech is a special talk that has the function to set the underlying tone and summarize the core message or most important revelation of the academic event at which it is given.

An academic event that, as a part of a larger academic event, has the function to group even smaller parts of the academic event, like sessions and talks, according to a shared theme or topic. It usually has dedicated chairs and program committees.
An academic event whose sociocultural format is determined in an academic event type specification that classifies the academic event as a forum.
A hackathon is a gathering of software developers with the goal to develop software collaboratively in a short timeframe.

A seminar can serve as a term for older conference series, but in current usage the term mainly describes a specific teaching format that serves to develop content and provides space for discussion. Participation from the audience is usually encouraged.

A symposium is a specific type of conference with a narrower thematic focus, with fewer participants and of shorter duration. The degree of structuring lies between a classic conference and a workshop, allows more discussion than the larger conference, but is usually more formalized than the workshop.
An academic event that has the function to educate the audience on a certain topic. A tutorial is often realized as an academic event talk or academic event session.

Workshops are smaller academic events that serve to exchange information on a specific topic or problem. They usually last one or two days and offer space for discussion and the development of content and solutions. Group work is often part of the event concept.

This value is to be used if the event format cannot be represented using one of the other permissible values defined in the [EventFormat](https://stroemphi.github.io/ConfIDent-schema/EventFormat/) enum. If this value is chosen the use of [other_format](https://stroemphi.github.io/ConfIDent-schema/academicEvent__other_format/) is mandatory.

enums.name: EventStatus
enums.description: The status of the academic event which indicates if it takes place as planned.

permissible_values.description: Default: used to indicate that the event takes place as planned.

enums.name: EventMode
enums.description: An enum to specify if an academic event is in person, virtual or a hybrid of both.

permissible_values.description: The event takes place in a physical location.
The event takes place in a virtual location.
The event takes place physically and virtually.

enums.name: DeadlineType
enums.description: An enum that specifies the possible kinds of deadlines of an academic event.

permissible_values.description: This value is to be used, if the other allowed values are not applicable.

enums.name: RelationType
enums.description: The kinds of relations that are allowed between academic events.

enums.name: MetricType
enums.description: The possible metric of an academic event.

permissible_values.description: The time frame in which the events of a series reoccur.
If true then the event is accessible for people with impairments.

enums.name: ContributorType
enums.description: An enumaration used to distinguish the contributors of a planned process with regard to them being either an organization or a person.

permissible_values.description: An institution, or an association that has one or more people as members and which actsas some kind of participant in a planned process.
A human being that acts as some kind of participant in a planned process.

slots.name: type
slots.description: An abstract property that is reused in certain classes to differentiate their instances according to the type enums defined as the range.

slots.name: doi
slots.description: A property to provide a digital object identifier (DOI) according to https://doi.org/.

slots.name: wikidata_id
slots.description: A property to link an entity with its Wikidata identifier.

slots.name: name
slots.description: A property to provide a name of a schema entity.

slots.name: id
slots.description: A property to provide an internal id of a schema entity in the ConfIDent plattform.

slots.name: external_id
slots.description: A property to provide an external id of a schema entity.

slots.name: value
slots.description: a property to provide the literal value of a schema based entity.

slots.name: schema_base_uri
slots.description: The base URI of the schema that provides the context for the schema based value.

slots.name: process_name
slots.description: A property to provide a name of the academic event or series, which itself if further differentiated (e.g. official name, acronym, etc).

slots.name: landing_page
slots.description: A property to provide the website to which a persistent identifier is resolving and which contains all the metadata about an academic event or series.

slots.name: organizers
slots.description: A property to provide the organizers of an academic event or series.

slots.name: academic_fields
slots.description: A property to describe the scientific subject(s) of a planned process, according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus. If this is used, its subproperties [value] and [schema_name] are mandatory.

slots.name: website
slots.description: A property to provide the URL the official website of a planned process.

slots.name: contact
slots.description: The contact person of an academic event or event series.

slots.name: publications
slots.description: The published works that are related to the academic event or event series, such as proceedings and video recordings of talks.

slots.name: topics
slots.description: A property to provide the theme and topics of an academic event or event series as free keywords, phrases or text.

slots.name: metrics
slots.description: A property to provide metrics of an academic event or series.

slots.name: context_info
slots.description: A property to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description.

slots.name: wikicfp_id
slots.description: A property to link a planned process with its WikiCFP identifier.

slots.name: dpbl_id
slots.description: A property to link the a planned process with its DBLP identifier.

slots.name: academicEventSeries__series_of
slots.description: A property to link to the events that are part of an academic event series.

slots.name: academicEvent__start_date
slots.description: The start date of an academic event or event series. Wheres the latter will in reality most likely be the start date of the first event of this series, unless there is some other source from which it is possible to derive the date of the inception of the series.

slots.name: academicEvent__end_date
slots.description: Similar to start_date but only for the end of an academic event or event series.

slots.name: academicEvent__in_series
slots.description: The relation used to provide the series of which an AcademicEvent is a part.

slots.name: academicEvent__at_location
slots.description: The location of the academic event.

slots.name: academicEvent__deadlines
slots.description: A property to provide deadlines of an academic event.

slots.name: academicEvent__related_to
slots.description: A property to be used

slots.name: academicEvent__ordinal
slots.description: The ordnial number of an academic event within its series.

slots.name: academicEvent__event_mode
slots.description: The event mode describes whether the event is a physical, virtual or hybrid event.

slots.name: processName__official_name
slots.description: The official name of an academic event or series.

slots.name: processName__acronym
slots.description: The official acronym of an academic event or series.

slots.name: processName__former_name
slots.description: The former official name of an academic event or series. Usually this will only be needed in case an academic event series has undergone a name change.

slots.name: processName__translated_name
slots.description: A translation of the official process name to be used in different language contexts.

slots.name: processName__aliases
slots.description: A property to provide alternative names of a planned process.

slots.name: eventFormatSpecification__specified_as
slots.description: A mandatory property to provide the format of an academic event as string, in order to further specify its type in case it could not be specified according to the possible values of [EventType](EventType).

examples.description: An example to provide a format specification for special type of academic event that is not in the schema's [EventType](EventType) enum.

slots.name: deadline__deadline_date
slots.description: The date of a deadline.

slots.name: deadline__deadline_other
slots.description: A property to specify another type of deadline, if this type of deadline is not within the allowed values of [DeadlineType](DeadlineType).

slots.name: metric__int_value
slots.description: A property to provide an integer value for a metric.

slots.name: metric__str_value
slots.description: A property to provide a string value for a metric.

slots.name: metric__rate_value
slots.description: A property to provide a rate value as float for a metric.

slots.name: metric__truth_value
slots.description: A property to provide a truth value for a metric.

slots.name: metric__description
slots.description: A property to provide a description of a metric.

slots.name: location__city
slots.description: The property to specify the [City](City) of an academic event location.

slots.name: location__country
slots.description: The property to specify the [Country](Country) of an academic event location.

slots.name: location__region
slots.description: The property to specify the [Region](Region) of an academic event location.

slots.name: location__venue
slots.description: The property to specify the [Venue](Venue) of an academic event location.

slots.name: location__lattitude
slots.description: The property to specify the lattitude of an academic event location.

slots.name: location__longitude
slots.description: The property to specify the longitude of an academic event location.

slots.name: location__meeting_url
slots.description: The property to specify the URL under which a one can participate virtually in an academic event.

slots.name: venue__street
slots.description: The street of the venue including the house number seperated by comma.

slots.name: venue__zip_code
slots.description: The zip code of the venue.

slots.name: context__text
slots.description: The free text used to provide more context information on a planned process.

slots.name: context__license_str
slots.description: The license of the context information as text, which must be used when copying text from other sources.

slots.name: context__license_url
slots.description: The license of the context information as URL, which should be used when copying text from other sources and such a URL exists.

slots.name: organizer__contact
slots.description: The contact person of an academic event or event series.

slots.name: contactPerson__email
slots.description: The email address of the contact person.

slots.name: contactPerson__telephone
slots.description: The telephone number of the contact person.

slots.name: confIDentRecords__events
slots.description: A property to provide a list of academic events within this container.

slots.name: confIDentRecords__series
slots.description: A property to provide a list of academic event series within this container.

classes.name: SchemaBasedThing
classes.description: A mixin used in classes that contain schema based values, such as the classifications used to denote the academic field of an event or the external identifiers used to denote a thing.

classes.name: NamedThing
classes.description: A mixin used to provide the attributes needed for the identification of named class.

classes.name: PlannedProcess
classes.description: Abstract base class for academic events and event series.

classes.name: AcademicEventSeries
classes.description: An academic event series describes the set of academic events which take place on a regular basis and thus have an established common identity. This identity is constituted, for example, through institutional continuity in the hosting of a series (e.g. by a specialised society), thematic focuses and/or a common label under which a series is defined (particularly name and acronym). Nevertheless, it is possible that each of these criteria may change over time.

attributes.name: series_of
attributes.description: A property to link to the events that are part of an academic event series.

classes.name: AcademicEvent
classes.description: An academic event is part of the established instruments of science communication as a format for conveying the latest scientific publications. It is defined by the meeting of researchers at a specific time and place (virtual or physical) and with a specific thematic focus to present, hear and discuss these publications. In contrast to other forms of events, academic events should primarily serve the exchange of results and methods of scientific research and their didactic mediation.  Furthermore, a significant participation of scientific organizations in the realization of an academic event is constitutive for this type of event; for example, to distinguish it from events in which researchers mainly act as external experts or with a purely legitimising function.

attributes.name: start_date
attributes.description: The start date of an academic event or event series. Wheres the latter will in reality most likely be the start date of the first event of this series, unless there is some other source from which it is possible to derive the date of the inception of the series.

attributes.name: end_date
attributes.description: Similar to start_date but only for the end of an academic event or event series.

attributes.name: in_series
attributes.description: The relation used to provide the series of which an AcademicEvent is a part.

attributes.name: at_location
attributes.description: The location of the academic event.

attributes.name: deadlines
attributes.description: A property to provide deadlines of an academic event.

attributes.name: related_to
attributes.description: A property to be used

attributes.name: ordinal
attributes.description: The ordnial number of an academic event within its series.

attributes.name: event_mode
attributes.description: The event mode describes whether the event is a physical, virtual or hybrid event.

classes.name: ProcessName
classes.description: The container for the various names denoting a planned process

attributes.name: official_name
attributes.description: The official name of an academic event or series.

attributes.name: acronym
attributes.description: The official acronym of an academic event or series.

attributes.name: former_name
attributes.description: The former official name of an academic event or series. Usually this will only be needed in case an academic event series has undergone a name change.

attributes.name: translated_name
attributes.description: A translation of the official process name to be used in different language contexts.

attributes.name: aliases
attributes.description: A property to provide alternative names of a planned process.

classes.name: ExternalIdentifier
classes.description: An identifer of an entity declared in another schema.

classes.name: DigitalObjectId
classes.description: A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify digital objects given by International DOI Foundation.

classes.name: WikidataId
classes.description: The identifier of a thing (item) in Wikidata.

classes.name: GndId
classes.description: The identifier of a thing (item) in the German National authority file.

classes.name: TibkatId
classes.description: The identifier of a publication in the TIB catalog.

classes.name: DblpId
classes.description: The identifier of an academic event or series in dblp.

classes.name: WikiCfpId
classes.description: The identifier of an academic event or series in WikiCFP.

classes.name: EventFormatSpecification
classes.description: An academic event format specification is a plan specification that classifies a planned gathering of people in an academic context according to some sociocultural format, which provides implicit and explicit details on how this gathing is to be carried out by its participants in terms of achieving certain objectives, fulfiling certain conditions and performing certain actions. It thus concretizes the expectations of the contributors of an academic event. While the explicit details are often provied as concrete parts (e.g. deadline or attendance fee specifications), the implicit details depend on the semantics encoded in the words used for the classification of academic events (e.g. "conference" or "workshop"). Depending on the sociocultural background these classifications can overlap or vary to a certain degree.

attributes.name: specified_as
attributes.description: A mandatory property to provide the format of an academic event as string, in order to further specify its type in case it could not be specified according to the possible values of [EventType](EventType).

examples.description: An example to provide a format specification for special type of academic event that is not in the schema's [EventType](EventType) enum.

classes.name: Deadline
classes.description: A container for event deadlines.

attributes.name: deadline_date
attributes.description: The date of a deadline.

attributes.name: deadline_other
attributes.description: A property to specify another type of deadline, if this type of deadline is not within the allowed values of [DeadlineType](DeadlineType).

classes.name: Metric
classes.description: A container for statistical information about a planned process.

attributes.name: int_value
attributes.description: A property to provide an integer value for a metric.

attributes.name: str_value
attributes.description: A property to provide a string value for a metric.

attributes.name: rate_value
attributes.description: A property to provide a rate value as float for a metric.

attributes.name: truth_value
attributes.description: A property to provide a truth value for a metric.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: A property to provide a description of a metric.

classes.name: ProcessRelation
classes.description: A container for relations between academic events.

classes.name: Location
classes.description: A container for the information about the location in which an academic event takes place.

attributes.name: city
attributes.description: The property to specify the [City](City) of an academic event location.

attributes.name: country
attributes.description: The property to specify the [Country](Country) of an academic event location.

attributes.name: region
attributes.description: The property to specify the [Region](Region) of an academic event location.

attributes.name: venue
attributes.description: The property to specify the [Venue](Venue) of an academic event location.

attributes.name: lattitude
attributes.description: The property to specify the lattitude of an academic event location.

attributes.name: longitude
attributes.description: The property to specify the longitude of an academic event location.

attributes.name: meeting_url
attributes.description: The property to specify the URL under which a one can participate virtually in an academic event.

classes.name: City
classes.description: The city in which an academic event takes place.

classes.name: Country
classes.description: The country in which an academic event takes place.

classes.name: Region
classes.description: The region in which an academic event takes place. For non USA events this might often be negligible.

examples.description: the US state Texas as an example of a region

classes.name: Venue
classes.description: The venue at which an academic event takes place.

attributes.name: street
attributes.description: The street of the venue including the house number seperated by comma.

attributes.name: zip_code
attributes.description: The zip code of the venue.

classes.name: AcademicField
classes.description: An academic field is the scientific subject of a planned process according to some controlled vocabulary or thesaurus and as such requires the scheme URI.

classes.name: Context
classes.description: A container to provide extra information, such as call of papers event description.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The free text used to provide more context information on a planned process.

attributes.name: license_str
attributes.description: The license of the context information as text, which must be used when copying text from other sources.

attributes.name: license_url
attributes.description: The license of the context information as URL, which should be used when copying text from other sources and such a URL exists.

classes.name: Contributor
classes.description: A contributor is a person or organization that holds a contributor role which is being realized in a planned process.

classes.name: Sponsor
classes.description: A sponsor of an academic event or event series.

classes.name: Attendee
classes.description: A attendee of an academic event.

classes.name: Moderator
classes.description: A moderator of an academic event.

classes.name: Organizer
classes.description: An organizer of an academic event or event series.

attributes.name: contact
attributes.description: The contact person of an academic event or event series.

classes.name: ContactPerson
classes.description: The contact person of an academic event or event series.

attributes.name: email
attributes.description: The email address of the contact person.

attributes.name: telephone
attributes.description: The telephone number of the contact person.

classes.name: CommitteeMember
classes.description: A members of an academic event committee.

classes.name: CommitteeChair
classes.description: The head of an academic event committee.

classes.name: Presenter
classes.description: A person that presents its work at an academic event.

classes.name: KeynoteSpeaker
classes.description: A 'keynote speaker' is a presenter that is an invited person - often a multiplier in his or her (research) field - responsible for delivering a keynote speech.

classes.name: Publication
classes.description: A published work, e.g. proceedings or conferenc paper, that is the output of an academic event or series.

classes.name: ConfIDentRecords
classes.description: A container to be able to bundle academic event and series data in one data file (e.g. YAML or JSON).

attributes.name: events
attributes.description: A property to provide a list of academic events within this container.

attributes.name: series
attributes.description: A property to provide a list of academic event series within this container.
